member.name: T:CodeForDotNet.Data.Sql.SqlDataAccessLayer
member.summary: Disposable base class for a SQL Data Access Layer which holds connection information and helper methods.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Data.Sql.SqlDataAccessLayer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the database connection (but does not open it). Ensure this object is disposed to close the connection if it was opened.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.Data.Sql.SqlDataAccessLayer.Connection
member.summary: Current connection, for the lifetime of this object. Opened on the first call to OpenConnection(), closed during Dispose.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Data.Sql.SqlDataAccessLayer.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes resources either proactively via or during finalization.
member.param: True when disposing, false when finalizing.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Data.Sql.SqlDataAccessLayer.OpenConnection
member.summary: Opens or re-opens the connection if closed or broken.

member.name: T:CodeForDotNet.Data.Sql.SqlExtensions
member.summary: Extensions and helper methods for working with SQL.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.Data.Sql.SqlExtensions.ParameterCache
member.summary: Cache of items for a given command hash-code.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Data.Sql.SqlExtensions.BuildConnectionString(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an SQL Server connection string from common pieces, e.g. server name, database, user & password (if not integrated security).
member.param: Database server name or (local) for shared memory local access.
User name or null/empty for Windows integrated security.
Password or null/empty for Windows integrated security.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.Data.Sql.SqlExtensions.CreateCommandWithParameters(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a command object for the specified stored procedure, automatically populating the parameters. Parameter sets are cached for performance.
member.param: Connection used to derive parameters (first time only) or create the command.
Name of the stored procedure for which to create the command and parameters.
